        public <T extends Resource> T instantiate(Class<T> clazz)
        Delegates to the internal dataStore instance. This is a convenience mechanism to eliminate the constant need to call client.getDataStore() every time one needs to instantiate Resource.
        Specified by:

      • getResource

        public <T extends Resource> T getResource(String href,
                                          Class<T> clazz)
        Delegates to the internal dataStore instance. This is a convenience mechanism to eliminate the constant need to call client.getDataStore() every time one needs to look up a Resource.
        Specified by:
        getResource in interface DataStore
        Type Parameters:
        T - type parameter indicating the returned value is a Resource instance.
        Parameters:
        href - the resource URL of the resource to retrieve
        clazz - the Resource sub-interface to instantiate
        Returns:
        an instance of the specified class based on the data returned from the specified href URL.

      • create

        public <T extends Resource> T create(String parentHref,
                                     T resource)
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Creates a new resource and returns the instance as represented by the server. This could mean default values have been set, modification dates changed, etc.
        Specified by:

        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:

        resource - the object payload to to send to the server

        Description copied from interface: DataStore

        NOTE: this is typically done by using resource.save() instead of this method.
